intro: Athroisma boranense, commonly known as the Boranense cress, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and is typically found in moist, grassy habitats. It has been used traditionally for its edible leaves and seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
